content: In CSV format, create a list of ten different types of teas from around the world. Each entry should include the tea's name, country of origin, flavor profile, and brewing instructions.

Sure! Here's a list of ten different types of teas from around the world in CSV format:

"Tea Name","Country of Origin","Flavor Profile","Brewing Instructions"

"Matcha","Japan","Umami, grassy, slightly bitter","Whisk 1-2 teaspoons of matcha powder with hot water (70-80°C) until frothy."

"Assam Black Tea","India","Bold, malty, full-bodied","Steep 2.5 grams in boiling water for 3-5 minutes."

"Darjeeling Black Tea","India","Floral, musky, light-bodied","Steep 2.5 grams in boiling water for 3-4 minutes."

"Earl Grey","United Kingdom","Bergamot infused, citrusy, slightly floral","Steep 1 teaspoon in boiling water for 3-5 minutes."

"Green Tea","China","Grassy, vegetal, slightly sweet","Steep 2 grams in 80°C water for 2-3 minutes."

"Oolong Tea","China/Taiwan","Complex, ranging from floral to toasted","Steep 5 grams in boiling water for 2-5 minutes, multiple infusions."

"White Tea","China","Delicate, subtle, slightly sweet","Steep 3 grams in 80-85°C water for 4-5 minutes."

"Chai","India","Spicy, sweet, with notes of cinnamon and cardamom","Simmer masala spices with milk and sugar, add black tea leaves and steep for 3-5 minutes."

"Herbal Tea","Global","Varies widely depending on herbs used","Steep 1-2 teaspoons of dried herbs in boiling water for 5-10 minutes."

"Pu-erh","China","Earthy, smooth, with a slight aged flavor","Rinse leaves briefly with boiling water, steep 5-7 grams in boiling water for 20-30 seconds to several minutes, multiple infusions."

I hope this helps! Let me know if you need more information.
